final_answer:
The humor and satire in this image come from the juxtaposition of two contrasting scenes under the headings "YES," and "BUT." 

On the left, the silhouette of a child petting a cow represents innocence and the caring interaction between humans and animals. It signifies an appreciation for animals in their natural state.

On the right, the person happily eating a burger made from beef underscores the irony. It highlights the contradiction between showing affection for animals and consuming them as food. This contrast serves as a humorous commentary on human behavior and attitudes towards animals, pointing out the cognitive dissonance in loving animals yet eating them.
